docs.lead_paragraph: From a strange creature called "Puppymonkeybaby" to a tear-inducing Audi ad, Super Bowl ads ran the gamut this year from offbeat humor to heartfelt messages.

headline.main: Offbeat Humor and Upbeat Messages Dominate Super Bowl Ads
headline.print_headline: Offbeat Humor and Upbeat Messages Dominate Super Bowl Ads

docs.snippet: From a strange creature called "Puppymonkeybaby" to a tear-inducing Audi ad, Super Bowl ads ran the gamut this year from offbeat humor to heartfelt messages.

docs.lead_paragraph: Experts on microcephaly, the birth defect that has sparked alarm in the current Zika virus outbreak, say they are struck by the severity of a small number of cases they have reviewed from Brazil.

headline.main: Insight-Doctors Puzzle Over Severity of Defects in Some Brazilian Babies
headline.print_headline: Insight-Doctors Puzzle Over Severity of Defects in Some Brazilian Babies

docs.snippet: Experts on microcephaly, the birth defect that has sparked alarm in the current Zika virus outbreak, say they are struck by the severity of a small number of cases they have reviewed from Brazil.

docs.lead_paragraph: Australia pledged up to A$500,000 ($354,000) in aid for its  Pacific island neighbors on Sunday to help combat the spread of the Zika virus after an outbreak in Tonga last week raised concern in the region.

headline.main: Australia Pledges Aid to Help Tonga, Pacific With Zika
headline.print_headline: Australia Pledges Aid to Help Tonga, Pacific With Zika

docs.snippet: Australia pledged up to A$500,000 ($354,000) in aid for its  Pacific island neighbors on Sunday to help combat the spread of the Zika virus after an outbreak in Tonga last week raised concern in the region.

docs.lead_paragraph: Two Republican U.S. presidential hopefuls said on Saturday they would implement quarantines of travelers if necessary to stop the spread of the Zika virus.

headline.main: Republican U.S. Presidential Hopefuls Say Zika Quarantine May Be Needed
headline.print_headline: Republican U.S. Presidential Hopefuls Say Zika Quarantine May Be Needed

docs.snippet: Two Republican U.S. presidential hopefuls said on Saturday they would implement quarantines of travelers if necessary to stop the spread of the Zika virus.

docs.lead_paragraph: After much criticism, the Centers for Disease Control and Prevention defended its recommendation to refrain from drinking alcohol if women are not using birth control.

headline.main: C.D.C. Defends Advice to Women on Drinking and Pregnancy

docs.snippet: After much criticism, the Centers for Disease Control and Prevention defended its recommendation to refrain from drinking alcohol if women are not using birth control.

keywords.value: Centers for Disease Control and Prevention
keywords.name: organizations

docs.lead_paragraph: Olympic and sports federation officials have reacted to the Zika virus threat at the Rio Games in such an unhurried way that some view it as tone deafness.

headline.main: One More Thing for U.S. Women’s Soccer Team to Worry About
headline.print_headline: Soccer a Center of Fear on Zika

docs.abstract: Jere Longman On Olympics column holds that soccer events present one of biggest challenges for Olympic and health officials in combating Zika virus ahead of 2016 Olympic Games; notes that events will be contested in five additional cities, increasing chance of exposure, risk that is particularly distressing for female athletes.
docs.snippet: Olympic and sports federation officials have reacted to the Zika virus threat at the Rio Games in such an unhurried way that some view it as tone deafness.

keywords.value: United States Women's National Soccer Team
keywords.name: organizations

docs.lead_paragraph: Global health officials have said that the Zika virus, which has been linked to severe birth defects in thousands of babies in Brazil, is rapidly spreading in the Americas and could infect up to 4 million people.

headline.main: Factbox-Why the Zika Virus Is Causing Alarm
headline.print_headline: Factbox-Why the Zika Virus Is Causing Alarm

docs.snippet: Global health officials have said that the Zika virus, which has been linked to severe birth defects in thousands of babies in Brazil, is rapidly spreading in the Americas and could infect up to 4 million people.

docs.lead_paragraph: Authorities in Brazil said on Friday Zika has been detected in patients' saliva and urine, adding to the concern over the spread of the virus, while U.S. officials offered new guidance on sex for people returning from Zika-hit regions.

headline.main: Zika Found in Saliva, Urine in Brazil; U.S. Offers Sex Advice
headline.print_headline: Zika Found in Saliva, Urine in Brazil; U.S. Offers Sex Advice

docs.snippet: Authorities in Brazil said on Friday Zika has been detected in patients' saliva and urine, adding to the concern over the spread of the virus, while U.S. officials offered new guidance on sex for people returning from Zika-hit regions.

docs.lead_paragraph: The U.S. Centers for Disease Control and Prevention on Friday revised its guidelines for pregnant women to include a recommendation that even those without symptoms of the Zika virus should be tested after returning from affected areas.

headline.main: U.S. CDC Widens Zika Virus Guidelines for Pregnant Women
headline.print_headline: U.S. CDC Widens Zika Virus Guidelines for Pregnant Women

docs.snippet: The U.S. Centers for Disease Control and Prevention on Friday revised its guidelines for pregnant women to include a recommendation that even those without symptoms of the Zika virus should be tested after returning from affected areas.
